page.title: 02SPARE TIME PURSUITS
page.content: This area, though a scattered farming community apart from Deanston village, is well served by a variety of clubs for all ages & interests providing people are willing to travel using their own transport as buses are infrequent.Only two clubs actually meet within the area _ Tuesday Club run by Kilmadock Church for youngsters in the village & Deanston Ladies Club. Other clubs available to the community are _ C.of S.Woman's Guilds, W.R.I., Brownies, Guides, Cubs, Scouts, Boys' Brigade, Curling, Golf, Rifle, Bowling Young Farmers, Football, Rotary and Scottish Dancing. These & other clubs meet in the surrounding towns and villages. Membership of Masonic Lodges outwith the area is also available. Currently popular with a section of the community are Bingo Clubs. Addicts travel regularly to enjoy sessions.
